content: The Act titled "Small Business Procurement Improvement Act of 2012" aims to increase small business participation in multiple award contracts. The Small Business Act is amended to include small business concerns in multiple award contracts to a greater extent. The Small Business Act is amended to include set-aside programs for small businesses in various sections and establish an Agency Outreach Program for procurement requirements. It also defines terms like Blanket Purchase Agreement and Basic Ordering Agreement. SEC. 4. ENSURING SMALL BUSINESS PARTICIPATION IN CONTRACTS. Section 15(g)(1) of the Small Business Act is amended to require the President to annually establish Government-wide goals for task orders and delivery orders placed against contracts awarded to small business concerns. The Small Business Act is amended to establish Government-wide goals for contracts awarded to small businesses owned by service-disabled veterans, HUBZone qualified businesses, socially disadvantaged individuals, and women. SEC. 5. IMPROVEMENTS TO THE SMALL BUSINESS RESERVE. Section 15(j) of the Small Business Act is amended to increase the threshold from $100,000 to $200,000 and to include regulations for task or delivery orders placed against multiple award contracts, including those under the Federal Supply Schedule program. The Administrator will issue regulations within 120 days in consultation with the Administrator of General Services Administration. The Administrator of General Services Administration must issue regulations within 120 days on ensuring correct size standards, implementing non-manufacturer rule, and subcontracting provisions at the task order level, and displaying information on electronic ordering systems. The Administrator of General Services Administration will ensure correct size standards, implement non-manufacturer rule, and subcontracting provisions at the task order level, and display information on electronic ordering systems. SEC. 6. Small Business Representation on the Federal Acquisition Regulatory Council. Amends Section 1302(b)(1) of title 41, United States Code to include the Administrator of the Small Business Administration on the council. In case of an equal vote, the Administrator of the Office of Federal Procurement Policy will have the deciding vote.
